rta.promptText: Is your living situation covered by the Residential Tenancy Act?

am-I-covered.promptText: Use the following resource to determine if you are covered by the Residential Tenancy Act.

choices.choiceText: TRAC: Am I Covered by the RTA

no-rta.promptText: If you are not covered by the RTA you will find it hard (but not impossible) to fight back. The following organizations may be able to assist you.

written-notice.promptText: Have you received a written eviction notice?

harassment.promptText: Has your landlord tried to change your locks, threaten you, or harass you in any way?

choices.choiceText: Yes, I need to speak with an advocate right away!
No, but I think my landlord wants to evict me.

proper-form.promptText: Was it on the proper form?

unlawful-notice.promptText: Your notice is likely not lawful. Take some time to learn about your rights.

choices.choiceText: Next Step: Write a Letter to Your Landlord

reason-for-eviction.promptText: What was the reason for your eviction?

choices.choiceText: I did not pay my rent or utilities in full and on time
The eviction is related to something I am alleged to have done (i.e issues with noise, guests, etc)
I am being evicted for 'no fault'

10-days-to-move-out.promptText: Were you given 10 Days Notice to Move Out?

5-days-since-notice.promptText: Have more than 5 days passed since you received your eviction notice?

able-to-pay-rent.promptText: Are you able to pay your rent in full within 5 days of receiving this notice?

choices.choiceText: Yes, I should pay my landlord immediately.

10-days-since-notice.promptText: Have more than 10 days passed since you received notice?

specific-cause.promptText: Did your landlord indicate what specifically you did wrong?

formal-warning.promptText: Did your landlord ever give you a formal warning?

chance-to-address.promptText: Did your landlord give you a chance to address the issue?

15-days-since-notice.promptText: Have more than 15 days passed since you received notice?

bad-faith.promptText: Do you have evidence that the reason your landlord gave for your eviction is misleading or untrue?

defend-yourself.promptText: If you think you have a case to dispute your eviction or your landlord's claims, you'll need to file a dispute with the Residential Tenancy Branch.

evidence.promptText: Do you have evidence to counter your landlord's allegations?

choices.choiceText: Yes, I have documentation and/or a willing witness that can provide a statement to support my version of events.

self-defence.promptText: Learn your tenant rights with the following resource.

get-landlord-info.promptText: Use the following form letter to determine your landlord's information.

choices.choiceText: TRAC: Landlord's Legal Name and Address

illegal-eviction.promptText: Use the following form letter to dispute your eviction.

find-an-advocate.promptText: Use the following resource to find an advocate.

contact-the-vtu.promptText: Use the following resource to contact the VTU

missed-contestation-window.promptText: It seems like you probably missed the window to contest your eviction. To be sure, you could try contacting a legal advocate and/or reading about your rights.

choices.choiceText: Please take some time to report your landlord here.
